title: Camshaft Finger Follower - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Removal operations for PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1

body.body: Remove the sealing plugs from the left and right hand side of the cylinder head.
Each finger follower shaft retains two finger followers.
Prior to removal, mark, or make a note of the relative positions of each finger follower. The finger followers must be refitted in their original positions.
For the removal of the finger follower shafts, they are to be removed in the direction indicted in the illustration below.
Note that the exhaust retaining pins appear to be further in the cylinder head compared to inlet retaining pins.
Remove the retaining pin securing the finger follower shafts in position.
Using a suitable extendable magnet, slide out the shafts and remove each finger follower as they are released.
To prevent the shims from becoming mixed, place the shims in a marked container. The shims must be refitted in their original positions.
Note the position of all shims so that they can be refitted in the same positions. Remove the shims.

search: Camshaft Finger Follower - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Rider’s Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Camshafts - Removal
Remove the sealing plugs from the left and right hand side of the cylinder head.
Sealing plugs (left hand side shown)
O-rings
Each finger follower shaft retains two finger followers.
Prior to removal, mark, or make a note of the relative positions of each finger follower. The finger followers must be refitted in their original positions.
For the removal of the finger follower shafts, they are to be removed in the direction indicted in the illustration below.
Finger Follower Shaft Removal Direction
Note that the exhaust retaining pins appear to be further in the cylinder head compared to inlet retaining pins.
Remove the retaining pin securing the finger follower shafts in position.
Using a suitable extendable magnet, slide out the shafts and remove each finger follower as they are released.
Retaining pin
Shaft
Finger followers
To prevent the shims from becoming mixed, place the shims in a marked container. The shims must be refitted in their original positions.
Note the position of all shims so that they can be refitted in the same positions. Remove the shims.
